name: Trainline
highlights: Re-platformed the main desktop app
Built many smart, dumb and reusable React components complete with TypeScript and accessibility
Owned the main 'Journey Summary sidebar' component that works alongside search results & checkout flow
Built a ‘sticky component’ that changes position depending on other elements positioning and/or props
Refactored various selectors and unit tests
Built a login form with email validation
Built seat reservations & delivery options components
Google calendar API integration
Built a ‘pricebot’ feature in the mobile web app that searches and returns the cheapest available price

name: Plantstove
highlights: More info coming soon.

name: Fiona Ross
highlights: Redesign for mobiles/tablets/any device size
Modular, component based architecture
News feed from node API
Customised music player
Various smart features/components such as collaborators and gallery

name: Boots BetaLabs
highlights: 6 different apps for various stores and consumers
Modular, component based architecture with shared, reusable codebases
Ecommerce checkout for a bespoke touch screen app
Dynamic, custom 'time entry type tracker' utilising d3.js
Various email and mobile validation components
Improved test coverage and tech debt
CoreMetrics analytics integration

thoughts.copy: I'm very proud of the 'dynamic time entry type tracker' I built - a custom d3.js chart component that renders months of data into easy-to-use charts. With several other steps involved for this component, including data entry, this API heavy feature results in the following chart complete with touch sliding to next/previous charts:
I also contributed to an ecommerce checkout that involved many smart and dumb components such as this basket and custom email validation step, complete with a show/hide email toggle:
Because we had smart, reusable components, we could easily build similar custom validation steps and toggles for mobile numbers:

name: Network Locum
highlights: Built many new features and components within a large existing codebase
Modular, component based app/architecture
Heavy use of custom directives/components
Greatly improved the test coverage

thoughts.copy: I really enjoyed building the 'My Circles' feature which enabled users to manage groups of 'favourites'. Many actions and filters could be applied here, so we managed these states with Redux.
We also built an invitation component that could be easily re-used:

I also had the pleasure of adding an additional step to the job creation processs. With some nice JavaScript calculcations and a complex UI form, the new step allows you to define a timeframe in which a job could be allocated to a particular group prior to other groups.

name: Saranac
highlights: Large greenfield, wealth management app
Rich, complex data visualization
Mock API and datastore
Heavy use of custom directives/components

thoughts.copy: I really enjoyed using the Highcharts API and particulary building custom legends (including dropdowns):
We also built many visually small, but logically complex components, like these bar graphs:

name: Mean tweets
highlights: Created from the ground up in order to learn more about Node, Express and MongoDB
Built a fairly in-depth node API that interacts with a DB
Clean and modular angular app on the front end
Built a timeline feature that queries the API depending on who a user follows and the followee's tweets/retweets

name: Angular ticker
highlights: Built an open source simple ticker directive for easy re-use in any project
Automatically scrolls through a list of items, fading in/out
Configurable timing

name: Angular proof of concept demos
highlights: Created whilst learning and seeking examples of some angular features
Various examples of forms, ng-repeat, services, directives, scope watch, testing

Built some core features involving business logic, angular routing and more
Owned the UI - integrated designs, branding

name: Reedsy
highlights: Contributed to the first version of the product, building new features, integrating designs, branding
Built and maintained a custom, scalable UI framework to be used on any device, anywhere
Various 3rd party and social media integrations
Built multiple landing pages during launch

thoughts.copy: I owned the UI/front-end of the platform (a marketplace for Indie Authors), as part of a 2-man, remote dev team.
